extracted-table.table-caption: Rs‐fMRI studies investigating correlation between functional connectivity and genetic burden in manifest and presymptomatic Huntington's disease individuals

caption.p: Rs‐fMRI studies investigating correlation between functional connectivity and genetic burden in manifest and presymptomatic Huntington's disease individuals

tr.td: Higher FPN FC correlated with higher disease burden
Wolf, Sambataro, Vasic, Baldas, et al., 2014
Lower VIS FC correlated with higher disease burden
Wolf, Sambataro, Vasic, Depping, et al., 2014
Lower ECN FC correlated with higher disease burden
Lower cerebellar network FC correlated with higher disease burden
Lower PCC‐DMN nodal degree correlated with higher number of CAG repeats
Lower subcortical FC correlated with higher number of CAG repeats
Negative correlation between overall hypoconnectivity and disease burden
Lower SMN FC was associated with higher disease burden
Correlation between burden score and graph measures in the SMN
Strengthened whole‐brain FC of the inferior parietal lobe correlated with higher disease burden

fn.p: DMN, default mode network; ECN, executive network; FC, functional connectivity; SMN, sensory‐motor network; VIS, visual network, FPN, frontoparietal network.
